snippet: While Greece agreed last week to cut pensions, Spain said it would raise its payouts, a stark example of why Europe’s debt and deficit problems have proved so difficult to resolve.
abstract: News analysis; Greece, under last-chance pressure, had agreed to severely cut public pensions, but Spain said it would raise its payouts 1 percent in 2013; move exemplifies why Europe’s debt and deficit problems have proved so difficult to resolve.
lead_paragraph: While Greece agreed last week to cut pensions, Spain said it would raise its payouts, a stark example of why Europe’s debt and deficit problems have proved so difficult to resolve.

headline.seo: Greek-Spanish Pension Split Illustrates Europe’s Dilemma
headline.main: Greek-Spanish Pension Split Illustrates Europe’s Dilemma
headline.print_headline: Greek-Spanish Pension Split Illustrates Europe’s Dilemma
